content: What is the name of the historical document that was signed in 1215, limiting the powers of the English King and is often seen as a symbol of freedom from tyranny?

I'm confident that the document you're referring to is the Magna Carta. It was indeed signed in 1215 and is considered a foundational document in the history of constitutional law. The Magna Carta limited the power of the English monarch, particularly King John, and established the principle that everyone, including the king, is subject to the law. This document has had a profound influence on the development of legal systems around the world, including the United States.
